Who Still Buys Wite-Out, and Why?

Correction fluids have improbably outlasted the typewriter and survived the rise of the digital office

David A. Graham
Mar 19

Christmastime is when the pens in my house get their biggest workout of the year. Like many Americans above grammar-school age, I seldom write by hand anymore, outside of barely legible grocery lists. But the end of the year brings out a…
